name: Vegan Soy free Frittata with Mushroom Chard Shallot Almond-Feta. Glutenfree Recipe
description: Vegan Soy free Frittata with Mushroom Chard Shallots and Almond Feta. Chickpea flour frittata. Dairy-free Savory breakfast recipe. No Tofu. Gluten-free. makes one 6.5 inch pan
recipeIngredient: 1/2 teaspoon salt (less if your feta is tangy)
a generous pinch of Indian black salt (kala namak)
a generous pinch of garlic powder
2 teaspoons chopped fresh herbs (I used oregano and thyme or a teaspoon of dried herbs.)
Chili flakes or black pepper to taste
1 Tablespoon extra virgin olive oil (optional, use 1 Tbspn more coconut milk)
1/4 cup sauteed mushrooms or chopped mushrooms (I sauteed the mushrooms in a little oil for a few minutes)
1  large rainbow chard leaf chopped small  (or other greens)
1/4 cup Ricki's Almond Feta cheese  (or Kite hill brand almond ricotta or other non dairy cheese crumbles)
a few Tablespoons non dairy cheddar or mozzarella or jack

recipeInstructions.text: In a bowl, whisk all the dry ingredients for even distribution.
recipeInstructions.name: In a bowl, whisk all the dry ingredients for even distribution.

recipeInstructions.text: Add the wet to the dry, whisk into a smooth batter.
recipeInstructions.name: Add the wet to the dry, whisk into a smooth batter.

recipeInstructions.text: Add chard, mushrooms, veggies and crumbled cheese and mix.
recipeInstructions.name: Add chard, mushrooms, veggies and crumbled cheese and mix.

recipeInstructions.text: Pour the thick batter into a greased or parchment lined pan. Spread evenly.
recipeInstructions.name: Pour the thick batter into a greased or parchment lined pan. Spread evenly.

recipeInstructions.text: Bake for 35 minutes at 375 degrees F / 190ºc or until toothpick from the center comes out almost clean. You want it just about done and not over baked.
recipeInstructions.name: Bake for 35 minutes at 375 degrees F / 190ºc or until toothpick from the center comes out almost clean. You want it just about done and not over baked.

recipeInstructions.text: Let rest for 5-10 minutes before slicing.
recipeInstructions.name: Let rest for 5-10 minutes before slicing.

recipeInstructions.text: Serve hot or cold as is or with a side of roasted veggies or potatoes. Top with additional non dairy cheese or sauces of choice.
recipeInstructions.name: Serve hot or cold as is or with a side of roasted veggies or potatoes. Top with additional non dairy cheese or sauces of choice.

recipeInstructions.text: Can be kept refrigerated in a closed container for 2 days. Warm in the oven before serving.
recipeInstructions.name: Can be kept refrigerated in a closed container for 2 days. Warm in the oven before serving.

recipeInstructions.text: The recipe can easily be doubled. The consistency of the batter should be thick, so adjust dry ingredients if needed for a larger batch.
recipeInstructions.name: The recipe can easily be doubled. The consistency of the batter should be thick, so adjust dry ingredients if needed for a larger batch.
